intro: Celmisia tomentosa, commonly known as the silky celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its soft, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
